intro: Sida neogranatensis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or neogranatensis sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in disturbed soils and agricultural fields. Its small, five-petaled flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
